posts.author: Last Call
posts.content:
Having recently become enamored of the many awesome features of the Monk class, and inspired by Valerfor's Sword Saint builds,
I thought to put together my own version. Intrigued by Blackguard, and not having played one before, I ran the combo through the
CBC and came up with something pretty solid. There are a number of monk/blackguards in the Epic Character Search Engine, but only one with this
class combination: Infernal Mantis, which is a drastically different animal.

This came together pretty nicely: 42 AB, decent 2H damage, nice Taunt, Epic Vrock, and the laundry list of Monk abilities, including the highly addictive move speed.
Unfortunately, no stylish robes, no UMD, not enough skill points, and delayed Improved Evasion and mind immunity for earlier Epic Fiend.

Of the thematically correct weapon choices - no-dachi (greatsword), naginata (halberd), or ono (greataxe) - I chose the naginata mostly for
the more awesome attack animations; the dual damage types and x3 crits are nice as well. (Unfortunately, I'm finding a shortage of good halberds on WoG.)

Some tweaking would allow for stealth or Dev Crit.

The name comes from a kind of Japanese steel: created this build this while impatiently waiting on my new kitchen knife, a Hiromoto 190mm santoku made of Aogami Super.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
A very interesting build Last Call, you get Monk 20 for all the immunities but you fight in full plate and wield a Greatsword, i like it!

May i suggest a little twist perhaps?

Sinc you gain nothing from the two last BG lvls, you can exchange them with two FTR ones. Now it all depends from how badly you want "Listen" in your skill list. If you change your starting attributes to STR 17, DEX 08, INT 13 you will need one less Great STR epic feat to reach 30. Take the fourth FTR lvl in it's place and grab both WS/ EWS ending in the same 30 STR but gain +6 Dmg.


* I think it is also time to test my new trick Empyre taught me, Aogami Knife

posts.author: Last Call
posts.content:
The last BG levels are to max Taunt. I waffled about going for WS/EWS, but sacrificed the +6 damage for the effective +6 AB. Such are the sacrifices we make in character building...

Is there a better halberd in WoG than the Lance of the Paynim?


(Thanks to Empyre, I too learned something: AS Santoku. Not me or mine, but the knife is amazing)

Unfortunately, no stylish robes...
Unfortunately some of the items on that "laundry list" depend on going unarmored; no armor and no shield. Among those is the highly addictive monk speed.

posts.author: Last Call
posts.content:
Damn! My low-level testing was insufficient (I only have the char to lvl 16 on WoG).

There is a perceptible speed increase at Monk 3, and seemingly at M6, in heavy armor. It seemed logical that the speed continued to increase, but having now tested heavy armor on a much higher level monk, it does not. I found a reputable-sounding source in the old ECB that claimed monk speed was unaffected by armor, and I wanted to believe it...alas. Fortunately, SR and immunities aren't affected.
